reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Contribution to a strong and resilient health system

description.narrative: Madagascar - RSSH - Ministry of Public Health of the Republic of Madagascar - MOH. This program has the following goals: Réduire à zéro la mortalité liée au paludisme d'ici 2030. / Reduce malaria mortality to zero by 2030.. Accélérer la riposte au VIH d’ici 2020 afin de parvenir à l’élimination de l’épidémie de sida d’ici à 2030 / Accelerate the response to HIV by 2020 in order to achieve the elimination of the AIDS epidemic by 2030. Réduire le taux de mortalité due à la tuberculose de 75% à l'horizon 2030 par rapport à l'année 2018 / Reduce the mortality rate due to tuberculosis by 75% by 2030 compared to 2018.. The objectives of this program are: Diagnostiquer au moins 95% des cas suspects de paludisme par TDR ou Goutte épaisse selon les directives nationales d'ici 2024. / Diagnose at least 95% of suspected malaria cases by RDT or Thick Drop according to national guidelines by 2024.. Traiter au moins 95% des cas confirmés de paludisme selon les directives nationales d'ici 2025. / Treat at least 95% of confirmed malaria cases according to national guidelines by 2025.. Réduire d'au moins 75% les nouvelles infections à VIH chez les populations clés, les jeunes de 10 à 24 ans et dans la population générale entre 2018 et 2025. / Reduce new HIV infections by at least 75% among key populations, young people ages 10 to 24, and the general population between 2018 and 2025.. Améliorer la qualité des services offerts pour les PVVIH grâce à une approche centrée sur le patient et à des soins différenciés aux niveaux des centres de santé et de la communauté./ Improve the quality of services for PLWHA through a patient-centered approach and differentiated care at the health center and community levels.. Traiter 100% des patients TB diagnostiqués et accroître le taux de succès thérapeutique à au moins 90% pour la TB sensible d'ici 2024 / Treat 100% of diagnosed TB patients and increase the treatment success rate to at least 90% for susceptible TB by 2024.. Améliorer la gestion, le suivi et l'évaluation des programmes et renforcer les systèmes de santé, résilients et pérenes pour répondre efficacement à la lutte contre le VIH/Sida, la Tuberculose et le Paludisme./ Improve program management, monitoring and evaluation and strengthen resilient and sustainable health systems to respond effectively to the fight against HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria.

title.narrative: Percent of district health management teams or other administrative units that have developed a monitoring plan, including annual work objectives and performance measures
Percentage of facilities that receive supportive supervision – at least once per quarter
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Percentage of service delivery reports from community health workers integrated into HMIS
Percentage of health product batches for the three diseases tested for quality in line with Global Fund Quality Assurance policy
Malaria I-3.1(M) Number of malaria deaths among hospitalized patients per 100,000 population per year
TB I-3(M) Tuberculosis mortality rate per 100,000 population
Malaria I-6 Under-five mortality rate, all causes, per 1,000 live births
HIV I-4 Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
Percentage of facilities providing diagnostic services on the day of the assessment
Percentage of health facilities with tracer medicines for the three diseases available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
